casebody.data:
DICESARE, et al.
v.
The CHARLOTTE-MECKLENBURG HOSPITAL AUTHORITY 156A17-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 11, 2019 Russ Ferguson, III, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, James P. Cooney, III, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Mark J. Horoschak, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Brian Allen Hayles, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Debbie W. Harden, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Michael P. Fischer, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Matthew Tilley, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Hampton Y. Dellinger, Attorney at Law, for The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Hospital Authority. Sarah Motley Stone, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Hospital Authority, d/b/a Carolinas Healthcare System. Reynolds Michael Elliot, Attorney at Law, for DiCesare, Christopher, et al. Linwood Jones, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for N.C. Hospital Association.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 3rd of June 2019 by Plaintiffs to admit Kathleen Konopka Pro Hac Vice:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of June 2019."
